learning_outcomes.description: Analyse the key modern issues in Macroeconomics, such as economic growth, business cycles, consumption, savings, investment, government expenditure and unemployment, with an emphasis on stylised facts, analytical modelling and statistical underpinnings.
Examine macroeconomic policy challenges in industrial and developing countries and to assess the contribution of macroeconomic policies to growth and stabilisation.
Explain the hidden logic behind, and critique, macroeconomic models using both a formal mathematical approach, econometric analysis, and critical reasoning.
Evaluate the links between macroeconomic analysis, macroeconomic policymaking, and other social sciences, including political science.

assessments.due_date:
15/04/2025 5:40 pm

Exam starts at 4:00 pm and ends at 5:40 pm on 15/04/2025.
assessments.task_description:
This will be a closed-book, invigilated, paper-based in-semester exam, to be held during class. It will cover material from Weeks 1 through 6 (inclusive), and will consist of short answer and problem solving questions.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.due_date:
28/04/2025 - 22/05/2025

Research assignment is due by 4:00 pm on 22/05/2025.
assessments.task_description:
The research assignment is a challenging, authentic and complex assessment task that has been designed to connect the theories covered in class with the evidence.

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI or MT technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The research assignment must be submitted electronically by the due date and time via the Turnitin link on the course Learn.UQ (Blackboard) site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
